description: This crash occurred in the right lane of the northbound lanes of an undivided roadway with two lanes in each direction.  The roadway was straight and level, and it was cloudy and raining.  The roadway was wet and had a posted speed limit of 48 kmph (30 mph). The crash occurred at a 4-way signalized intersection.  Vehicle #1 was a 1999 Toyota Camry that stopped for an emergency vehicle traveling westbound with the emergency lights on.  Vehicle #2 was a 2000 Nissan Sentra that was behind Vehicle #1 and could not stop in time.  Vehicle #2 rear-ended Vehicle #1.   The emergency vehicle was crossing over the intersection.A seventy-four year old male who did not sustain any injuries drove the Toyota Camry.  He stated that he saw the emergency vehicle trying to go through the intersection so he slowed down and came to a stop.  As he stopped, he was rear-ended by Vehicle #2.

The crash occurred on a two-way, two-lane, not physically divided roadway.  It was mid-morning and heavy rain was present.  The gradient for both roadways of vehicle 1 and vehicle 2 travel were level.  The posted speed limit on the roadway was 64 kmph (40mph).V1, a 1999 Pontiac Sunfire operated by a 18-year-old male, was traveling westbound.  V2, a 2003 Hyundai Elantra operated by a 24-year-old male, was traveling eastbound.  V1 crossed the centerline, entered the eastbound lane, and impacted V2 head-on.  The impact caused V1 to rotate counterclockwise; V1 came to final rest in the westbound lane facing south.  The driver of V2 was initially traveling straight and then attempted to avoid the collision by steering the vehicle to the right.  V2 rotated clockwise before coming to final rest between a mailbox and telephone pole.  Both vehicles were towed from the scene. The driver of V1 was transported by EMS to a local hospital.  After obtaining the interview from the driver of V1, it is likely that work and sleep patterns contributed to this crash. The driver was traveling home after working the graveyard shift.

This two-vehicle collision occurred mid-afternoon in a three-way intersection.  Southbound traffic was controlled by a stop sign traffic device.  Road surface dry asphalt, no adverse weather condition or sight restrictions. The posted speed limit 48 kMmph (30 mph). The east/west roadway has a +8% grade.Vehicle one (V1), a 1994 Yamaha 600cc motorcycle driven by a 36 year-old male, was traveling west. Vehicle two (V2), a 1993 Ford Crown Victoria sedan driven by a 39 year-old male with three passengers, was traveling south in the process of making a left turn after stopping at a stop sign, As V2 entered the intersection V1, according to witnesses was driving at a high rate of speed, changed lanes to the left and collided with the left side of V2. The driver of V1 came to final rest at the northwest corner of the intersection and the motorcycle came to rest in the intersection at point of impact. V2 came to rest facing east in the westbound lanes. Both  V1 and V2 were towed from the scene, the driver of V1 was transported to a local medical facility.The critical pre-crash event for V1 was coded: other vehicle encroachment, from crossing street, turning into opposite direction. The critical reason for the critical event was not coded to this vehicle.  Associative factors for V 1 driver are as follows: driver performed various decision errors (aggressive driving behaviors).  V 1 driver violated a traffic signal, accelerated excessively  while weaving in and out of travel lanes, and failed to look far enough ahead for possible crossing traffic.  Medical reports indicated V1 driver  had an abnormal level of amphetamine.
